contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox city Japan |Name= Nanbu |JapaneseName= 南部町 |settlement_type= Town |MapImage= Map Nanbu,Tottori en.png |Region= [[Chūgoku region|Chūgoku]] |Prefecture= [[Tottori Prefecture|Tottori]] |District= [[Saihaku District, Tottori|Saihaku]] |Area_km2= 114.03 |PopDate= 2006 |Population= 12,042 |Density_km2= auto |Coords= |LatitudeDegrees = 35 |LatitudeMinutes = 20 |LatitudeSeconds = |LongtitudeDegrees = 133 |LongtitudeMinutes = 20 |LongtitudeSeconds = |Tree= |Flower= |Bird= |SymbolImage= |SymbolDescription= |Mayor= |CityHallPostalCode= |CityHallAddress= |CityHallPhone= |CityHallLink= [http://www.town.nanbu.tottori.jp/ Town of Nanbu] }} {{nihongo|'''Nanbu'''|南部町|Nanbu-chō}} is a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Saihaku District, Tottori|Saihaku District]], [[Tottori Prefecture|Tottori]], [[Japan]]. Nanbu was founded on October 1, 2004 from the merger of the towns of [[Saihaku, Tottori|Saihaku]] and [[Aimi, Tottori|Aimi]], both from [[Saihaku District, Tottori|Saihaku District]]. As of 2006, the town has an estimated [[population]] of 12,042 and a [[population density|density]] of 105.60 persons per km². The total area is 114.03 km². Nanbu is home to {{nihongo|[[Tottori Hanakairo-Flower Park]]|とっとり花回廊|Tottori Hanakairō}}, Japan's largest floral theme park. It features extensive gardens, multi-lingual guide pamphlets, and a large indoor [[orchid]] cultivation area.<ref>[http://www.tottorihanakairou.or.jp/index.html とっとり花回廊]{{ja icon}}</ref> == Bordering municipalities == Nanbu, while located in Tottori Prefecture, borders on [[Shimane Prefecture]]. *Tottori Prefecture **[[Yonago, Tottori|Yonago]] **[[Hōki, Tottori|Hōki]] **[[Hino, Tottori|Hino]] **[[Nichinan, Tottori|Nichinan]] *Shimane Prefecture **[[Yasugi, Shimane]] == Transportation== ===Rail=== Nanbu is not served by rail. The closest rail station to Nanbu is [[Yonago Station]] in Yonago, served by the [[West Japan Railway Company|JR West]] [[San'in Main Line]] and JR West [[Sakai Line]]. ===Bus=== Nanbu is connected to Yonago by bus. *[[Hinomaru Bus Limited]] runs numerous routes between bus stops around Nanbu and Yonago city proper. *[[Nanbu Fureai Bus Lines]], a community bus line, connects most areas within Nanbu, as well as a few points in Yasugi, Shimane Prefecture. ===Highways=== *National Route **[[Japan National Route 180]] *Prefectural Routes **Tottori Prefecture Route 1 **Tottori Prefecture Route 35 **Tottori Prefecture Route 104 **Tottori Prefecture Route 160 **Tottori Prefecture Route 244 **Tottori Prefecture Route 454 ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons category-inline}} *[http://www.town.nanbu.tottori.jp/ Nanbu official website] {{ja icon}} *[http://www.tottorihanakairou.or.jp/ Tottori Hanakairo website] {{ja icon}} {{Tottori}} [[Category:Towns in Tottori Prefecture]] {{Tottori-geo-stub}}
